item.content:encoded:
Businesses worldwide desire an advanced mobile app on their Android and iOS platforms to serve their company. Most of them are caught in the middle where they have difficulty selecting the ideal technologies like ionic, hybrid, native for themselves.

Each approach to technology and development has its pros and cons, from which you have to select the best solution for your company. If you think Ionic is the correct platform application development, below are a few advantages and disadvantages of Ionic development.

Ionic Framework helps us to develop apps using only one codebase for several platforms. Let us learn how it works and what are this solution’s benefits and downsides. The frameworks are quite popular, however, in this blog, we will focus on the advantages and disadvantages of ionic application development. Let’s get right in with that statement!


What is an Ionic Application?

It is used to build hybrid mobile apps using the Open Source Software Development Kit(SDK). It is fully Apache Cordova and Angular based on this ionic framework. More specifically, Ionic is an npm module that requires Node JS to be installed.

The conditions for building these applications are excellent HTML, CSS and JavaScript commands. Because of their suitable properties and usefulness, many developers today opt for ionic frameworks. The main objective is to construct a hybrid mobile app in ionic framework development.

Hybrid applications provide several advantages compared with native applications, in particular in terms of development time. Essentially, the construction of ionic apps allows the captivating design and soft animations of native mobile components.

Ionic Mobile App Developer


Ionic Applications Are


● The cross-platform – single code base for both platforms (except native components)

● Web-based – Built using web-views and can be displayed in a browser like PWAs.

● Access to native API components – They can access the native device’s cameras, files, and others.


Advantages Of Ionic Application

A single codebase across various platforms

It was developed using the Angular and Apache Cordova frame and used as the fundamental technologies for app development HTML 5, CSS, and JavaScript. Alongside the current release of the Ionic, you may utilize Angular with all its advantages and disadvantages for the first time.

Free Open Source Framework

This frame is an open-source framework that is entirely free. Ionic framework applications offer platform-specific, optimized CSS features to match the native appearance of the different mobile operating systems. This Framework offers one of the primary advantages in the provision of CSS, HTML, and JS mobile-optimized code and reducing code rewriting needs.

Cross Mobile App Development

In application development, the development of efficient, compatible, and bespoke apps is of major importance. Ionic integrates with AngularJS, which enhances the interoperability of this code with mobile platforms. Ionic helps to swiftly create apps that make the app more popular and save time and money.

Testing convenience

While Ionic Apps only operate via a review, the browser of the device may be used to test the app. It is much handier because test equipment does not even need to be used to make sure it is all working properly. The same principle applies in the current world to a range of mobile devices.

Appealing Default UI

There are numerous common JavaScript and CSS components in these Framework apps covering many fundamental elements that would like to be developed by a moving app. The menu slides, inputs, buttons, lists, navigation, tab, sliding box, and pop-ups. standard styles are clean and simple, and developers may simply change them by adding CSS classes that have been given by the user to the device.

Quick Development and Time To Market

This development may benefit entrepreneurs and company owners when comparing a mobile app with native apps on both platforms in a short time. Constructing native apps particularly for each platform can take time, which can lead to a market delay and the cost of development of native applications is sometimes costly.


Disadvantages Of Ionic Application

Performance Issue

The performance of heavy apps is inappropriate for this application. When created with this Framework, apps with heavy realism or heavy graphics might crash.

The major reason behind this is that this application makes its graphics using a browser that does many stages on the screen.

There are, then, study performance optimization strategies to achieve better outcomes if you still want to develop a high-performance application utilizing Ionic.

Security Issues

You must not regard it as a con of this application on your own, but rather the possibility of a hazard with which you have to cope.

Security is a typical problem for the creation of hybrid apps as long as your program can be reversed. Ionic CLI is a prevalent approach since version 4 that makes the code tough for hackers to understand.

But you must also realize that there is no code uglification when you use Angular CLI or earlier versions of Ionic. The code will have to be Uglified by your developers yourself.

Dependency on Plugins

Even Ionic app development firms would admit that they must rely on plugins to have access to native features. You won’t be able to locate a corresponding plugin in the ionic toolset in some situations.

To build a plugin for very specialized features and functions, you must use the Ionic App development company.

If there is no plug-in, you will be able to discover a module most commonly. You’d probably have to make something that’s not in store with the aid of a native developer.

Hot Reloading not Available

To make modifications to the application code, this platform employs a variety of approaches. Hot reloading is regarded as a vital characteristic in the software engineering industry.

Because it allows you to make changes without having to refresh the entire program. It takes some getting accustomed to because it does not support hot reloading and instead relies on live reloading.

When you make changes, live reloading will refresh the whole app to make the changes active. That implies that whenever your developers wish to make changes, their program will be restarted.

conclusion

For your development, you have reviewed the pros and cons of utilizing this framework. Finally, it is crucial to have your application supported and problems solved on time by the proper Ionic application development firm.

item.content:encoded:
New heights have reached the evolution of customized app creation. Not just smartphones and tablets, but also other user devices and smart gadgets, are available for development. Time has become a requirement for cross-platform, hybrid, and native application development, which enables companies to produce more efficient goods.

While native applications offer numerous benefits, the popularity of hybrid mobile applications has grown. It’s due to its flexibility on many platforms. This idea leads to the development of a single application for many platforms. In addition, these apps make reserving a position in the app store market somewhat faster.

Those platform frameworks are extremely popular however, the advantage and disadvantages of hybrid mobile apps will be discussed in this article. Let’s get right in with that statement!

What Is a Hybrid Application?

A hybrid application allows the same software to be installed and even execute on different browsers in different operating systems like Android, iOS, Windows, and so on.

The use of a third-party hybrid platform is the development of a hybrid app or hybrid strategy. Third-party examples include React Native, PhoneGap, Ionic, Cordoba, or Xamarin. You may also use web technologies to create the app (HTML, CSS, and Javascript).

The development of this mobile app is primarily a way to build a mobile application utilizing a single code base for several platforms, such as Android and iOS. In this way, development expenses are dramatically reduced. On the other side though, there are certain advantages and disadvantages to this app creation.

Pros Of Hybrid Mobile Application

Lower Development Costs

The creation of hybrid apps has proven 30% cheaper compared to the native application development strategy. The hybrid method means that the developers just require an Android and iOS project. However, the expense of maintaining the mobile app on both platforms is increasing as the requirement for customization rises.

Easy To Maintain

The simpler maintenance of these mobile applications also benefits. For native applications, new versions need to be developed by the development teams. In addition, with each new version release, consumers will need to upgrade their apps. This app skips versioning and facilitates app maintenance in real-time, as it updates a web page.

Easy Scaling

Scale hybrid programs to a number of devices and OSes is extremely simple. That’s because web technology on all platforms is nearly 100% the same. This allows the code to be reused easily without any need to recompile the app at all.

Offline Support

The lack of offline support often implies that mobile applications suffer from restrictions. It is difficult for firms who serve clients in rural areas or places where connection to the Internet is a challenge. Statistics show that 70% of users quit an app because it takes too much loading time. One of the advantages of this application is its offline accessibility. The end-users thereby have continuous access to the data without any performance breakdowns.

Support for Cloud & Enterprise-Level Solutions

The Exchange Integration Code may be simply included in the cloud in this framework such as Ionic, Titanium, and PhoneGap. These frameworks are essentially simple to utilize, helping developers update program features, aesthetics, and validity. This allows developers to integrate hybrid applications easily with well-known cloud platforms such as Salesforce and AWS.

Improved Performance

Like native applications, this app provides excellent speed and performance. In fact, they are significantly quicker than advanced and responsive applications in some situations. The reason for this is that there is no reliance on network connectivity and even on apps with more users on all devices is greater.

10 Quick Tips for Hybrid Mobile App Developers

Cons Of Hybrid Mobile Application

UX

UX is really concerned with these applications. A hybrid application can never deliver a totally native experience for users. Native applications employ user-friendly system interface components, may produce a meaningful solution, and can contribute to maintaining the entire workflow. Without compromising performance, this cannot be accomplished with a hybrid app. Better UX enables increased consumer participation and the app’s future.

Limited capabilities

Due to the nature of the design of this mobile app, plugins allow you to use the integrated device capabilities. A method’s drawback is that these are outdated or unlikely to be trustworthy. In addition, if there are no prepared solutions that allow you to have access to a specific element of the device functionality, developers may require plug-ins alone.

Long Wait for New Features

Whenever Apple and Google release a new feature for iOS and Android platforms, hybrid app developers need some time to add support to the new feature. This is because new SDKs are available in the native apps much more quickly than the multifunctional framework. If you have developed your mobile apps with a native approach, it provides your rivals an edge over you.

Design

Design problems remain a consideration as many OSes work differently. The designer must thus change the look according to different operating systems. This might compel us to challenge ourselves in the process of mending. In hybrid applications the breadth of visual and graphical representation is limited.

Poor user experience

This needs to be high irrespective of what you want: a hybrid app or a native app. Unfortunately, the experience of the user is not a strong part of the hybrid apps because the interface should meet in the middle both for iOS and Android platforms. If you concentrate too much on Android, for iOS users, the experience will be poorer and vice versa.

Secrets of the Successful Hybrid Mobile Apps

Conclusion 

Considering everything, whether or not you should go down to one thing with the construction of hybrid mobile apps. For companies to gain a competitive edge, hybrid mobile applications are crucial. Knowledge and experience in the development of mobile multi-platform applications.

item.content:encoded:
Customers nowadays should be able to provide the best mobile experience for their visitors. Some companies thus opt not to apply native. We shall present another new technology called Progressive Web Apps in this post (PWAs). We discover how Progressive Web App operates, how they overcome the problems and weaknesses of PWA applications.

Progressive web apps (PWAs) are a fascinating technology that can revolutionize the way we create mobile and online applications. Some people may suggest though that PWA is only a website that’s turned into a mobile app, while some people argue about its capacity, safety, and performance.

So, This article explains the pros and cons of Progressive web apps, useful for your future web and mobile apps.

What Is Progressive Web App?

The progressive web app provides a user-like mobile experience. Therefore, the UX is tailored for the PWA device to provide the greatest information and features.

PWA is accessed by web users to enable consumers access to important native features, such as mobile home screen application, offline access, PWA notices of push

PWA allows web apps to load, synchronize and smoothly execute things when no network is present while giving your users a native experience.

Advantages Of Progressive Web App

PWAs are cheaper than other apps

Material has to be generated only once, which saves time and money by making content for iOS, Android and a website individually. In addition, PWAs need not be updated (some find this feature specifically cool). No new information needs to be downloaded by users. You don’t have to worry about their development if a PWA is operating.

Reliable

When loading, the app should be bright and should be shut and open if there is not a network or a relatively low-speed network like 2G. Google discovered if the page was loaded longer than 3 seconds, that 53% of people left the website.

User friendly

You don’t depend on app stores with PWAs. Search engines and other platforms can find PWAs. You may also provide a PWA on social networks, on your homepage, or through another element of your ecosystem. However, app stores offer the benefit of being able to reach a wide public in one shot.

Installable

If we want to bring web apps closer to native applications, they must be installed and reside with other native applications on the home screen, so that the user can use PWA with only one click.

Splash Screen

Adds a splash screen upon starting the app to the progressive Web App. That makes the PWA more resemble a native application.

Highly engage-able

Users should remain engaged with the app. PWA offers features such as push notifications to help users glorify their commitment, home screen icon, the full screen, and offline-first app.

Disadvantage Of Progressive Web App

Drains battery power

Since the phones have to work harder to comprehend the code, as they are written in complicated codes. This is why PWAs use more battery compared to native applications. So, consumers don’t worry about their battery life anymore and may not have to download such an application.

Unable to access various device features 

PWAs do not have access to numerous functionalities on your smartphone, therefore they are behind native applications. No access to NFC devices and also Bluetooth devices, sophisticated camera settings and so much more is available to PWAs. This means that the application is less than optimal for users.

No access to app stores

You are not exposed in an Apple or Android application store as a corporation if you build a PWA. Apps are frequently identified since they appear on one of the renowned app marketplaces. Therefore, it is a significant drawback that this “springboard” cannot be used by a wider public.

Functionalities 

Fewer and consequently less UX functionality. These web apps offer less functionality, unlike native apps. On Apple devices, iOS does not support complete PWAs functionality. 

This means that many users have restricted choices for PWAs, which is a pity. A lack of experience in UX (user experience) is a genuine loss at least as important in a world as the marketing of the product itself.

Lesser technical option

It is not possible to apply to PWAs all technical alternatives, such as Bluetooth or Near Field Communication (NFC). This implies that the applications you may have for your application are restricted. The question is whether PWAs can also make use of other future advances.

Conclusion

Using the Progressive Web App you have read the benefits and cons for development. In the end, it is vital that you have your application supported and solved problems on time by the proper PWA app development firm.

item.title: 10 Quick Tips for Hybrid Mobile App Developers
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: The post 10 Quick Tips for Hybrid Mobile App Developers appeared first on Hasotech.
item.content:encoded:
Though Hybrid Mobile App development considered underrated, There are still many Hybrid Mobile apps are being developed. Being Hybrid Mobile App Developers, we love Hybrid Mobile App Development. There are many popular apps like Amazon, Uber, Evernote, Facebook etc., The frameworks used to develop Hybrid apps makes Hybrid Mobile app developers easy to make it. To develop a successful mobile app, Hybrid Mobile app developers should follow some secret methods. Though there are many frameworks available to develop Hybrid Mobile apps like Ionic Framework, There are some tips for Hybrid Mobile App developers to follow.

 

Choose the Right Framework

 

  • When going with Hybrid Mobile app development, Choosing the right framework to develop is very important. There are many frameworks available. Some of them are Ionic Framework, React Native, Xamarin, PhoneGap etc., The very confusion moment is choosing between Ionic Framework or React Native. Ionic Framework is on Angular 4 and React Native is on React js. Since both are booming in the market, It’s hard to choose the right one.
  • Anyways, The purpose of developing the Hybrid Mobile App can define it. If you are looking to develop both Web and Mobile app, Then our suggestion is to go with Ionic Framework. Since it is on Angular JS which can be used in both Web and Mobile App, Number of resources to be used can be reduced.

 

We Love Hybrid Mobile App Development

 

  • There is a licensing Problem with React Native. It license says They can make it to full premium version anytime. So before choosing React Native, Make sure you can able to overcome the license problem.
  • If you are a .NET / C# Developer, Then the only option is Xamarin. Xamarin is a Microsoft product which uses C# as a base language to develop Hybrid Mobile app. Of course, You need Visual Studio tools to complete the development.

 

Ionic Framework – Lazy Loading Issue

 

  • If you are using Ionic Framework, Then you might be facing Lazy Loading issue in the new version. Still, Ionic Framework is working on it to overcome, There are some ways to fix the issue on our own. Instead of declaring all the Nodule Modules in the Main and pages where the node modules to be implemented. Declare the Node modules only in the pages. As the number of Node Modules increases on the Main page, The Lazy Loading time increases.
  • It is better to avoid unwanted node modules on the main page.

 

Don’t go with Hybrid Mobile App Development

 

Choosing the right Plugins

 

  • When we come to Hybrid Mobile App development, Definitely it is going to be on both Android and iOS and sometimes in Windows. While deploying the app to different platforms Plugins may get conflict. Some plugins may support only in Android and not on iOS.
  • Before choosing a plugin to implement the native function in Mobile App, Make sure it supports in all the platforms.

 

Checklist for Hybrid Mobile App Developers

 

  • Before choosing Hybrid App, Make sure the requirement can be done in Hybrid. If there are more native functions or if the app is very complex, It is suggested to go with Native. But still, if you want to go with Hybrid, Then make sure the app is being developed with proper performance check.
  • Inspect the App in chrome browser and check for Network and console logs. Try creating the apps without any error in console logs. As the error increases, It may affect the performance.

 

Hybrid Mobile App Development 

 

  • Make proper performance check in the browser and Mobile App testing before deploying in Play store or App store.
  • If the mobile app is targeted for lower versions of Android or iOS, Then Hybrid App is not the right choice. Hybrid Apps are meant for Android Lollipop versions and above and iOS 10. Though it supports from Jellybean, It is suggested to with Lollipop target.

Get your Virtual Reality Mobile Application

Virtual reality mobile application has been an emerging technology. Medical, entertainment, gaming, fashion etc., are using Virtual reality technology. Virtual reality uses three-dimensional frames which make a user to feel the objects as real. Just take the users to the virtual world. One of the very best implementations of Virtual reality is E-commerce. If you are in E-Commerce business and planning to develop an application. Virtual reality mobile application is the best technology to use. You might be thinking how about a user without virtual reality device. One can use the application in normal mode too.

Never Mess With Business Mobile App Development

Choosing the right tech stack to develop Virtual Reality Mobile Application is difficult one. The tech stack should be easy and beneficiary. Imagin, developing Web, Android and iOS VR application with same tech stack. With just one single code, Deploy on different platforms. Yes, It’s Hybrid Virtual Reality Mobile Application.

Developing Hybrid Virtual Reality Mobile Application

When it comes to Developing Hybrid Mobile Application we prefer Ionic Framework. Which is well-going technology for Hybrid. To deploy the application in different platform Ionic framework can be used. With single code get the app on Android and iOS and other mobile platforms. Developing Virtual reality mobile application is not possible with the Ionic framework. One of the best part going with Hybrid is, We can use Web Plugins in Mobile Applications. Similarly to develop virtual reality Mobile Application in Hybrid. We are going to use a Web Framework. aframe.io for building Virtual Reality Mobile application as well as Web Application.

Get Started with Virtual Reality Mobile Application

The installation process for Virtual Reality Mobile Application is very easy. aframe.io is a Javascript framework which obviously supports both on the web and hybrid mobile apps. For developing Virtual Reality Application, Initializing the Javascript file of aframe.io is enough. Check the link for detailed installation steps https://aframe.io/docs/0.7.0/introduction/installation.html

What’s crazy on Mobile App Development

3D Models for Virtual Reality Mobile application

3D Frames make best Virtual Reality Application. For a better experience, it must be developed with proper tools. There are many tools available to develop 3D images for Virtual reality.

Places to find 3D models include:

  • Sketchfab
  • Clara.io
  • Archive3D
  • Sketchup’s 3D Warehouse
  • TurboSquid

These tools can be used to generate 3D images for developing Virtual reality mobile application.

Very easy to Develop a Mobile App

Integrating aframe.io and Ionic Framework

To make virtual reality Mobile application, aframe.io should be integrated with Ionic Frameworks. The Ionic framework helps to deploy the application on Android and iOS. To make this happen, Create a new view in Ionic framework application and implement aframe.io application. This would bring the entire Virtual reality mobile application under the Ionic framework.

Now you are with Hybrid Virtual reality mobile application. Share your experience on virtual reality and developing such applications for your business.
